DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to assess the tolerance and utilization of agave inulin. This will be accomplished through analyses of breath and fecal samples to quantify fermentation end-products- hydrogen, carbon dioxide, and methane will be measured in the breath, and short-chain fatty acids, ammonia, phenol, and indole will be measured in feces. Microbial populations will also be measured in fecal samples.
DOC.brief_title: Tolerance and Utilization of Agave Inulin in Healthy Adults
DOC.detailed_description: The objective of this study is to assess the tolerance and utilization of agave inulin. This will be accomplished through analyses of breath and fecal samples to quantify fermentation end-products- hydrogen, carbon dioxide, and methane will be measured in the breath, and short-chain fatty acids, ammonia, phenol, and indole will be measured in feces. Microbial populations will also be measured in fecal samples.
DOC.criteria: have body mass index (BMI) between 18.5 and 29.5 kg/m2 free of metabolic and gastrointestinal diseases BMI less than 18.5 or greater than 29.5 kg/m2 presence of metabolic and gastrointestinal diseases pregnant or lactating taking medications that impact bowel function
